metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1057 on Ubuntu 16.04 FIPS Certified (xenial) - high.
metadata.Description:
On a Samba 4 AD DC the LDAP server in all versions of Samba from 4.0.0 onwards incorrectly validates permissions to modify passwords over LDAP allowing authenticated users to change any other users' passwords, including administrative users and privileged service accounts (eg Domain Controllers).

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-1057` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

ctdb - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.13
libnss-winbind - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.13
libpam-winbind - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.13
libparse-pidl-perl - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.13
libsmbclient - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.13
libwbclient0 - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.13
python-samba - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.13
registry-tools - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.13
samba - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.13
samba-common - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.13

smbclient - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.13
winbind - 2:4.3.11+dfsg-0ubuntu0.16.04.13
No subscription required
